title: Alex Bregman shares his advice for younger Red Sox teammates down the stretch
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Alex Bregman advises younger Red Sox players to simplify their approach as the postseason nears.
The Red Sox are 81-68 and hold the American League's second wildcard spot with 13 games remaining.
Bregman hit his first home run since August 12 in Saturday's 5-3 loss to the Yankees.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s 1-1 draw vs. Toronto FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The New England Revolution drew 1-1 with Toronto FC at Gillette Stadium, narrowly avoiding a home defeat.
New England remains in 11th place in the Eastern Conference but is technically still in playoff contention.
18-year-old Allan Oyirwoth made his MLS debut, earning praise for his composed performance in midfield.

title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora advises focusing on current games, not playoffs, despite team holding a wild card spot.
Boston's playoff odds are high with ESPN predicting a 90.6% chance, but Cora wants to focus on daily performance.
Cora addresses lineup challenges against left-handers, exacerbated by Roman Anthony's injury, impacting game strategy.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow is prioritizing hiring a general manager as a second-in-command for the Red Sox this offseason.
The Red Sox general manager position has been vacant since Breslow took over baseball operations in 2024.
Red Sox assistant GMs Raquel Ferreira, Eddie Romero, and others are potential candidates for the GM role.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade wide receiver Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints for a 2027 sixth-round pick.
New England also sends a 2028 seventh-round pick as part of the deal.
Polk struggled in 2024 with 12 receptions and was placed on injured reserve in 2025.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots have lost their last five games against the Dolphins in Miami.
The Dolphins, led by coach Mike McDaniel, are under scrutiny after a 33-8 loss to the Colts.
Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa is undefeated in his seven career starts against the Patriots.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed at Roadrunner, Boston on September 12, 2025, showcasing her Southern Gothic themed music.
Set design included Spanish moss and a cross-shaped microphone stand, enhancing the concert's haunting Southern ambiance.
The setlist featured songs from 'Willoughby Tucker, Iâ€™ll Always Love You' and concluded with 'American Teenager'.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars as Mike Flynt in 'The Senior', a film about a 59-year-old college football player's return to the field.
Chiklis, an Andover High alum, last played football in 1980 but undertook the role to capture a story of redemption.
Chiklis will attend a Boston screening of 'The Senior' on September 14, ahead of its national release on September 19.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Nine Massachusetts residents appear on the Forbes list of 400 richest Americans.
Abigail Johnson is the wealthiest in Massachusetts with a $35 billion net worth.
Massachusetts names on the list include Robert Kraft and New Balance's Jim Davis.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox struggle offensively, losing 4-1 to Yankees, with only two hits and zero for eight with runners in scoring position.
Boston's defensive errors, including a costly catcher interference, contributed to the Yankees' victory at Fenway Park.
American League playoff race remains open as no team is on pace to win more than 93 games this season.
